single.name: TV Acronyms

In engineering, a randomly generated signal; to us, nature sounds

Reporting that is based upon sensationalism rather than content, used often in relation to William Hearst

...into a green river demon from Japanese folklore, who drowns its victims

Human cells typically have 23 pairs of these

X-23 and Logan are both characters in the Marvel universe, who both have gone by this well-known superhero name
"Though I walk through the valley of the __ of the __" is a quote Psalm 23, the most well-known Psalm in the Bible
clues.answer: the valley of the shadow of death

"I got to light out for the territory ahead of the rest, because Aunt Sally she's going to adopt me and sivilize me, and I can't stand it. I been there before."
"So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past."

"The creatures outside looked from pig to man, and from man to pig, and from pig to man again; but already it was impossible to say which was which."
"It's funny. Don't ever tell anybody anything. If you do, you start missing everybody."

Also known as the "Lost Colony", this early settlement mysteriously disappeared, leaving only the word "CROATOAN" carved into a wall

The pseudonym of an unidentified man who hijacked a Boeing 727 and went missing after parachuting away with $200,000 in cash, becoming the only unsolved case of air piracy in commercial aviation history
An English sea explorer who explored the region around present-day New York City, who went lost after his crew mutinied and left him adrift in the James Bay
Famous labor union leader and Teamster who mysteriously disappeared in 1975, theorists speculate he was offed by the Mafia
A belief from Christianity that our fates have already been determined by God, also title in an Ethan Hawke movie

The fastest aerial animal is this type of falcon, with speeds up to 186 mph, food to eagles and other falcons
The Australian Tiger ___ is the fastest insect in the world, with speeds up to 6 mph (125x body lengths per second), food to lizards and birds

This play is about a director's efforts to mount a successful musical at the height of the Great Depression, named for the location where you might see it

This Tom Stoppard play is about the relationship between past, present, entropy, and a math tutor; no, not the city that's home to the annual 626 Night Market
A common symbol for this holiday, based on All Saints' Day and celebrated after Halloween on All Souls' Day, is the calavera.
clues.answer: Dia de los Muertos, Dia de Muertos, or Day of the Dead
